bibl.title: When Two Fragments Meet. A Funerary Stela for Two People from Roman Egypt (Nikopolis).
bibl.note: Joins two fragments of a Latin funerary stela set up for two people, a veteran of legio II Traiana fortis and an ignorus/a, discovered in the late nineteenth century at Sidi Gaber (site of the fortress of Nikopolis) and kept in the Graeco-Roman Museum in Alexandria under Inv. Nos 21623 and 21627 [ed.: Evaristo A. Breccia, Note epigrafiche, BSAA 20 (1924) pp. 269, No. 4; - 270, No. 17]. Nikopolis, ca. 213-250.
bibl.seg: Sophie Waebens, When Two Fragments Meet. A Funerary Stela for Two People from Roman Egypt (Nikopolis).

Joins two fragments of a Latin funerary stela set up for two people, a veteran of legio II Traiana fortis and an ignorus/a, discovered in the late nineteenth century at Sidi Gaber (site of the fortress of Nikopolis) and kept in the Graeco-Roman Museum in Alexandria under Inv. Nos 21623 and 21627 [ed.: Evaristo A. Breccia, Note epigrafiche, BSAA 20 (1924) pp. 269, No. 4; - 270, No. 17]. Nikopolis, ca. 213-250.
